alert.note: Alert for Jewell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 2:59AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Clay, western Nuckolls, eastern Franklin, Webster, Adams, eastern Kearney, southwestern Hamilton, southeastern Buffalo and Hall Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 258 AM CDT, Doppler Radar and automated weather stations indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kearney to near Norman to near Riverton. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler Radar and Automated Weather Stations. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grand Island, Kearney, Hastings, Minden, Gibbon, Wood River, Shelton, Red Cloud, Harvard, Blue Hill, Kenesaw, Doniphan, Clay Center, Juniata, Alda, Fairfield, Campbell, Glenvil, Lawrence and Bladen. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 272 and 321. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south central Nebraska.
